intro: Wedelia verbesinoides, commonly known as the creeping wedgeplant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically forms dense mats on the ground. The plant features small, opposite leaves that are usually rounded or ovate in shape. Its flowers are yellow and borne in clusters, adding ornamental value to gardens. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often used in landscaping for its ability to suppress weeds.
